critique: The document focuses on coordinating ocean-related matters, promoting economic growth in coastal communities, and ensuring sustainable use of ocean resources. It emphasizes interagency coordination and collaboration with stakeholders. There is no explicit mention of immigration. The document establishes an interagency Ocean Policy Committee to coordinate policies and provide advice. It revokes a previous executive order, suggesting a shift in approach. The document does not explicitly expand executive power but aims to streamline decision-making. It promotes economic growth and sustainable use of resources, suggesting a moderate approach to economic regulation. The document promotes collaboration and engagement with various stakeholders, suggesting a neutral stance on social inclusion.
